it.polimi.se2019.client.view

Class RemoteView

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.client.view.RemoteView

  • public class RemoteView
extends java.lang.Object
    RemoteView gathers and manages the data set of the game that the GUI uses to show to the user.
    INSTANTIATED BY: GUIController

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteView

        public RemoteView(java.lang.String username)
        Constructor of the class.
        Parameters:
        username: - will later be the key to retrieve the data set of a particular client.

    • Method Detail

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Retrieves the username that links a particular remote view with its user.
        Returns:
        the name chosen by the user, registered in this class's object.

      • getCharacter

        public java.lang.String getCharacter()
        Retrieves the character, i.e. the name of the game's pawn, associated with a particular remote view, and so with a particular user.
        Returns:
        the name of the character associated with a user.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Retrieves the position of the user's pawn in the map.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the square in which the user is.

      • getPoints

        public int getPoints()
        Retrieves the amount of points this user has scored up to now.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the points scored.

      • getPhaseAction

        public int getPhaseAction()
        Retrieves the info useful to manage what actions a client can do.
        0: normal abilities;
        1: "move & grab" with 2 moves granted;
        2: "shot" with a previous move granted along with the unlocked action from the 1.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the abilities a client may perform.

      • getFinalFrenzy

        public int getFinalFrenzy()
        Retrieves a boolean that tells us whether we are in the game finale or not. Necessary to represent the correct player board with the GUI, but mostly to enable the proper client actions.
        Returns:
        a boolean that represents in which phase the game is.

      • getMarkPlayerBoard

        public java.util.ArrayList<EnemyMark> getMarkPlayerBoard()
        Retrieves an ArrayList of Player objects that gives us the info on the amount and also the order of the marks taken from enemies by this user in particular.
        Returns:
        the ordered list of the marks given from other users to this user.

      • getDamagePlayerBoard

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getDamagePlayerBoard()
        Retrieves an ArrayList of Player objects that gives us the info on the amount and also the order of the damage taken from enemies by this user in particular.
        Returns:
        the ordered list of the blood damage given from other users to this user.

      • getDeathsPlayerBoard

        public int getDeathsPlayerBoard()
        Retrieves the number of times this particular user died in the game. This info is needed to manage in the proper way the diminishing value of points the enemies get when this user gets horribly killed.
        Returns:
        the amount of times this user got killed.

      • getWeapons

        public java.util.ArrayList<Weapon> getWeapons()
        Retrieves an ArrayList of Weapon objects currently in the hand of this user.
        Returns:
        a list of the weapons owned by the user.

      • getPowerUps

        public java.util.ArrayList<PowerUp> getPowerUps()
        Retrieves an ArrayList of powerUp objects currently in the hand of this user.
        Returns:
        a list of the power ups owned by the user.

      • getCanMove

        public boolean getCanMove()
        Retrieves the status of the move action started by the user:
        false: the user didn't press on move button yet;
        true: otherwise.
        Returns:
        a boolean that tells if the user asked to move or not.

      • getCubes

        public Cubes getCubes()
        Retrieves a Cubes object, a triplet of int values that represents the valuables of this game associated with this user.
        Returns:
        the amount of red, yellow and blue cubes the user own.

      • getReachableSquare

        public java.util.ArrayList<Square> getReachableSquare()
        Retrieves an ArrayList of Square objects that gives us the info on which squares are reachable from the currently position in the map of the user's pawn by the user's pawn itself.
        Returns:
        a list of squares reachable by the user from its position.

      • getNumberOfActions

        public int getNumberOfActions()
        Retrieves the amount of actions left to this user in this turn.
        Returns:
        the number of actions remained.

      • setPosition

        private void setPosition(int position)
        Sets in this remote view the updated position of the user's pawn in the map.
        Parameters:
        position: - an int that represents the up-to-date square in which the user is.

      • setCanMove

        private void setCanMove(boolean canMove)
        Sets the status of the move action:
        false: at the end of the move action;
        true: whenever the user clicks on the move button.
        Parameters:
        canMove: - a boolean that represents the will of the user to move or not.

      • setCubes

        private void setCubes(Cubes cubes)
        Sets the triplet of int values inside the Cubes object attribute of this class object that represents the up-to-date valuables of the game associated with this user.
        Parameters:
        cubes: -

      • setReachableSquare

        public void setReachableSquare(java.util.ArrayList<Square> reachableSquare)
        Sets a list of Square objects that are the positions on the map reachable by the user's pawn from its currently position.
        Parameters:
        reachableSquare: - list of squares reachable by the user from its position.

      • setNumberOfActions

        private void setNumberOfActions(int numberOfActions)
        Sets the amount of actions remained to the user in the current turn.
        Parameters:
        numberOfActions: - number of turn moves left to the user.

      • updateRemoteView

        public void updateRemoteView(VirtualView virtualView)
        Updates the status of this class object attributes with the up-to-date values. The data is retrieved from the SERVER side to the CLIENT side through RMI: here virtualview is obtained in GUIController class with the update method.
        Parameters:
        virtualView: - a VirtualView object, in short the SERVER counterpart of the RemoteView class.
